Let's look at the Jokers and their multipliers. Green Joker is at +13 mult now (+3 base + 10 Holo), and I know it gains +1 per hand played, but loses -1 per discard. The Mystic Summit has +15 mult when I have zero discards, which I need to think about. Spare Trousers is at +4 Mult, since my last hand was Two Pair. Certificate is already triggered, and I have Luchador (Polychrome, x1.5 mult) and Constellation (Negative, x2.1 mult).

Now, the math.  To clear 1290, let's consider the possible plays.  Green Joker is at +13 right now; and Spare Trousers, +4. That gives me a total +17 Mult. Then I have 1.5 * 2.1 = 3.15 xMult.

A simple High Card will score (5 + 10) * (1 + 17) * 3.15 = 850.5 chips. That's no good. A pair, though? A pair of 6s, which I have in the hand. That will be (70 + 6 + 6) * (6 + 17) * 3.15 = 5940.9 chips. A Pair is definitely the way to go.

So, I need 1290.  A pair of 6s will clear this round easily. Do I play more hands to pump the Green Joker even higher? I only have 3 hands left. I have a pair in my hand right now (the 6s). Playing it gets me an extra +$3 for the Gold Card, and +$2 for the hands I have remaining, and I'd be done with the round.

Alright, the action plan is simple: Play the Pair of 6s (Positions 2 and 7).  That's a Pair (Level 5).  Base of 70 chips and 6 mult. Plus the base 6 chip bonus for the pair.  Adding the mults, Green is +13, Trousers +4, and the total mults are 23.  xMult is 3.15.  Total: 82 * 23 * 3.15 = 5940.9.  That exceeds the goal.

The Green Joker will be +4 for the next round. I hold the Gold 8 of Diamonds and receive +$3.  Remaining Hands will give me +$2. Interest, after this, will be ($26 + $3 + $3 + $2)/5 = $6, which can be useful later.

So, the play is "play" and positions 2 and 7, and I intend a "pair". Estimated Chips: 5940.  I've double checked the 1-indexing: the cards are correct. And I am good to go.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
